info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 18 at 2:47PM MDT until April 18 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... South central Eddy County in southeastern New Mexico...
* Until 445 PM MDT.
* At 245 PM MDT, a dust channel was affecting US 285 near Carlsbad, as well as the surrounding area.
HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Trained weather spotters.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.
* US Highway 285, US 62, and other roads in the area may be affected.
Locations impacted include... Brantley Lake State Park, Carlsbad, Avalon, Lake Avalon, Otis, Cavern City Air Terminal, Carlsbad North, Living Desert State Park, Loving, Seven Rivers Airport, Malaga, and Lakewood.
info.instruction: Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 4:45 PM MDT. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 4:45 PM MDT. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 4:45 PM MDT. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 4:45 PM MDT. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.
